divs: sighting detailsapprox. 9:20pm july 4th 2010, my wife and myself took our dogs out in the backyard. we were watching some neighborhood firework displays when my wife exclaimed "what the hell is that?". i turned to look northward when i saw a red-orange sphere\orb moving eastwards. because our property has an abundance of trees, we were not able to follow it for long (maybe 20-30 seconds we could see it. the night sky was clear. the object was between 300 to 500 ft. off the ground. no sound of any sort was coming from the object. no navigational lights on the object just a steady red-orange glow. directly north from where i live is brookhaven calabro airport so i know the patterns of the incoming and outgoing air traffic. this is not the first time i've seen an object like this but this is actually the closest i've been to it, which was less than a mile. not sure of its size as there was nothing in the backround to compare to, only the trees in the foreground. i tried my best to see the object again but to no avail. my initial reaction was that it was perhaps a small plane on fire but there was not a smoke trail following it nor have i heard any reports today of a fire\crash. the object was flying slowly and low enough which makes me believe i was not the only one to veiw it.
